doc.title: Carlos Tevez should choose prestige over cash, says Silvio Berlusconi
doc.author: Guardian staff reporter
doc.description: Silvio Berlusconi believes Milan would provide the perfect environment for Carlos Tevez to relaunch his career
doc.tags: Carlos Tevez,Milan,Paris Saint-Germain,Manchester City,Transfer window,Football,Sport,Silvio Berlusconi

main.p: Silvio Berlusconi believes Milan would provide the perfect environment for Carlos Tevez to relaunch his career.
Milan have made several attempts to convince the Argentina striker to move to Italy and put an end to his ongoing dispute with Manchester City.

Paris St-Germain have also been linked, but Berlusconi, Milan's owner and former Italian prime minister, has urged the 27-year-old to put footballing reasons at the top of his agenda as he seeks a new club.
"If he comes with us, he will win the Golden Ball award," Berlusconi told Gazzetta dello Sport. "Tevez has two options, one which regards prestige and the other one money.

"Milan is prestige and he would have the possibility to showcase his talent around the world and win the Golden Ball with us. PSG represents a strong economic force. He must choose between one or the other."
Milan's vice-president, Adriano Galliani, insisted on Wednesday that the club would not enter a bidding war with PSG. Juventus have also been linked with the estranged City striker.
